sdp_rule.name: OS Certified?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the correct version of AIX required for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct version of AIX is installed on your server.

!!SHOWSTOPPER!! You do not have the correct version of AIX installed on your server. For the certified versions of AIX, see the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for AIX'', My Oracle Support and articles 885753.1 and 282036.

sdp_rule.name: User in /etc/passwd?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/passwd')),\ 'Can not read /etc/passwd',\ grepFile('/etc/passwd',\ concat('^',$usr = first(command('/usr/bin/id -nu')),':'),\ 'f'),\ 'userOK',\ concat($usr,' not in /etc/passwd.')))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user name of the user who runs this script is in the ``/etc/passwd`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/passwd`` file contains the user. No action is required.

The ``/etc/passwd`` file does not contain the user or else the file has no read permissions. Add the user to the ``/etc/passwd`` file if the user does not exist in the file. NIS-managed users are not recommended.

sdp_rule.name: Group in /etc/group?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/group')),\ 'Can not read /etc/group',\ grepFile('/etc/group',concat('^',command('/usr/bin/id -ng'),':'),'f'),\ 'GroupOK',\ 'Group not in /etc/group'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the group to which the user belongs exists in the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/group`` file contains the group of the user. No action required.
ALERT: The /etc/group does not contain the group. Add the group to the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_rule.name: Enter ORACLE_HOME
sdp_rule.sdp_command: Planned ORACLE_HOME location
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the planned Oracle home directory.

sdp_rule.name: ORACLE_HOME Valid?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $ORACLE_HOME call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)), 'OHNotSpecified',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHnotvalid',\ not(testDir('l',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHexists',\ 'OHsymlink'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the Oracle home directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Oracle home directory exists. No action required
No ``ORACLE_HOME`` value was provided for verification.

ALERT: There is something wrong with the Oracle home directory. Verify the following: |*Return Value*|*Action*| |OHnotvalid|Ensure that you provided the correct location or that this directory is created and then run this script again| |OHsymlink|ORACLE_HOME is a symbolic link|

sdp_rule.name: O_H Permissions OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $ORACLE_HOME call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)), 'OHNotSpecified',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHNotExist',\ not(testDir('r',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoReadPerm',\ not(testDir('w',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoWritePerm',\ not(testDir('x',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoExecutePerm',\ 'CorrectPerms'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the user has the correct privileges to install Oracle Database 11g in the Oracle home directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The permissions for the Oracle home directory are correct. No action required.
No ``ORACLE_HOME`` value was provided for verification.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |NoReadPerm|Ensure that the install user has read permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoWritePerm|Ensure that the install user has write permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoExecutePerm|Ensure that the install user has execute permissions for the Oracle home directory| |OHNotExist|The Oracle home directory does not exist. Create the Oracle home mount point and ensure that the permissions are set correctly (``chmod 755``)|

sdp_rule.name: oraInventory Permissions
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('f','/etc/oraInst.loc')),\ 'oraInventoryNotFound',\ not(testFile('wr',$INV_LOC = \ value(grepFile('/etc/oraInst.loc','^inventory_loc','f')))),\ 'oraInventoryNotOK',\ 'oraInventoryOK')) call setHcveVariable('$INV_LOC')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user installing Oracle Database 11g has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: Either the user, who is logged in, has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory to install Oracle Database 11g or this is the first Oracle product to be installed on the system. In that case, the installer creates ``oraInventory`` directory. No action required.

The user, who is logged in, cannot access (write) ``oraInventory`` while installing Oracle Database 11g . Verify that the user can write to the directory specified in the ``/etc/oraInst.loc`` file. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |oraInventoryNotOK|Make sure that the install user has write permissions to ${INV_LOC}| |oraInventoryNotFound|The ``/etc/oraInst.loc`` file was not found. This is not a problem if this is the first Oracle installation on the system|

sdp_rule.name: Got Software Tools?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the required assembly tools for the installation of Oracle Database 11g exist.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All required assembly tools for the Oracle Database 11g installation were found. No action required.

Some of the required assembly tools for the Oracle Database 11g installation were not found. Check your installation. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |ArNotFound|``ar`` is not found in ``PATH``| |LdNotFound|``ld`` is not found in ``PATH``| |NmNotFound|``nm`` is not found in ``PATH``| |MakeNotFound|``make`` is not found in ``PATH``| |ArElsewhere|``ar`` is found in ``PATH`` but not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` or symbolically linked to ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required| |LdElsewhere|``ld`` is found in ``PATH`` but not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` or symbolically linked to ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required| |NmElsewhere|``nm`` is found in ``PATH`` but not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` or symbolically linked to ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required| |MakeElsewhere|``make`` is found in ``PATH`` but not in ``/usr/ccs/bin`` or symbolically linked to ``/usr/ccs/bin`` as required|

sdp_rule.name: Umask Set to 022?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ expr('==','022',command('/usr/bin/umask')),'UmaskOK','UmaskNotOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.
The ``umask`` value is not set correctly. Set the ``umask`` to 022 before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: ulimits OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var @tbl =() macro get_ulimit_unl {var (\@tbl,$nam) = @arg var $lmt = field('\s+',1,grepLastFile(concat('^',$nam,'\('),'if')) if !defined($lmt) call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'NotDefined')) elsif compare('ne',$lmt,'unlimited') call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'TooSmall')) } call loadCommand('/usr/bin/ulimit -a') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'File') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'Time') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'Data') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'Stack') call get_ulimit_unl(\@tbl,'Memory') call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),'ulimitOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the ``ulimit`` settings are adequate for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``ulimit`` settings are adequate for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

Review the ``ulimit`` settings and check the recommended values from the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for AIX'' before installing the software. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |FileNotDefined|ulimit(FILE) is not defined| |FileTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(FILE) to unlimited| |TimeNotDefined|ulimit(TIME) is not defined| |TimeTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(TIME) to unlimited| |DataNotDefined|ulimit(DATA) is not defined| |DataTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(DATA) to unlimited| |StackNotDefined|ulimit(STACK) is not defined| |StackTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(STACK) to unlimited| |MemoryNotDefined|ulimit(MEMORY) is not defined| |MemoryTooSmall|Increase the ulimit(MEMORY) to unlimited|

sdp_rule.name: LDLIBRARYPATH Unset?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(defined(getEnv('LD_LIBRARY_PATH')),'IsSet','UnSet'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is not set.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is not set. No action required.
The ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is set in your environment and must be unset before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: LIBPATH Unset?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(defined(getEnv('LIBPATH')),'IsSet','UnSet'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``LIBPATH`` environment variable is not set.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``LIBPATH`` environment variable is not set. No action required.
The ``LIBPATH`` environment variable is set in your environment and must be unset before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: Enter JDK Home
sdp_rule.sdp_command: JDK Home
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the JDK home.

sdp_rule.name: JDK Version
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the installed JDK version is JDK 1.5.0 or later. This is required for products like Oracle Java Database Connectivity and Oracle Call Interface drivers.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct JDK version is installed.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need 1.5.0 or later|Install JDK 1.5.0 or later| |JDK bin directory is missing|Install full JDK package.| |JDK compiler is missing|Install full JDK package.| |... not verified|Cannot verify the version. Make sure JDK 1.5.0 or later is installed.| |JDK home is missing|Provide the correct location for JDK home.|

sdp_rule.name: Other O_Hs in PATH?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks to ensure that the PATH variable does not contain any references to other Oracle home directories based on the /etc/oratab entries.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The PATH does not contain any of the Oracle home directories found in the ``/etc/oratab`` file. No action required.

The PATH variable contains one or more references to the Oracle home directories found in the ``/etc/oratab`` file. Remove these references from the PATH variable before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: Other OUI Up?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ grepCommand('/usr/bin/ps -ef','runInstaller','i'),'AnotherOUIup',\ 'NoOtherOUI'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for another active ``runInstaller`` process on the system.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No other ``runInstaller`` process is running. No action required.
Stop the other instance of ``runInstaller`` that is active on your system.

sdp_rule.name: Temp Adequate?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that there is sufficient space available for storing temporary files during the Oracle Database 10g installation.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: There is sufficient temporary disk space available for installing Oracle Database 10g. No action required.

The temporary space is not configured correctly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |/tmp invalidDir|ALERT - ``/tmp`` is not a valid directory. ``/tmp`` needs to be a directory.| |/tmp NoWrite|ALERT - The user does not have write permissions to the ``/tmp`` directory.| |/tmp tooSmall|ALERT - There is less than the needed 240 MB of free space in the ``/tmp`` directory.| |TMP invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMP NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP}.| |TMP tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} has less than the required 240 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 240 MB of free space.| |TMPDIR invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMPDIR NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR}.| |TMPDIR tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} has less than the required 240 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 240 MB of free space.| |TMPDIR lessThan200|ALERT - ${`TMPDIR} has less than the required 200 MB of free space. Make sure your ${`TMPDIR} has at least 200 MB of free space.| Note: The ``runInstaller`` (OUI) uses or checks for temporary space by checking for the ``TEMP`` environment variable first, then the ``TMP`` environment variable, and finally the ``/tmp`` mount point. %BR%The operating system also requires additional space by creating files under ``/tmp`` or using the ``TMPDIR`` environment variable if it finds it.

sdp_rule.name: Disk Space OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the amount of disk space in the Oracle home directory is sufficient for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Oracle home directory has sufficient disk space to install Oracle Database 11g software and create a database. No action required.
No ``ORACLE_HOME`` value was provided for verification.

The Oracle home directory has insufficient disk space for installing any type of Oracle Database 11g architecture. Verify the specifications: |*Return Value*|*Action*| |OnlySpaceForOne|${`ORACLE_HOME} has sufficient free disk space to install the Oracle Database 11g software but not enough space to create a database.| |NoSpace|${`ORACLE_HOME} has insufficient free disk space for an Oracle Database 11g installation.| |OHNotValid|Disk space calculations cannot be performed because ${`ORACLE_HOME} is not a valid directory.|

sdp_rule.name: Swap (in MB)
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule shows the amount of free swap space.

sdp_rule.name: RAM (in MB)
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($mem) = match(grepCommand(\ "/usr/sbin/lsattr -HE -l sys0 -a realmem",'\s+\d+\s+','f'),'\s+(\d+)\s+') call setHcveResult(cond($mem,expr('/',$mem,1024)))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that your system has sufficient physical memory (MB) installed to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: You have sufficient physical memory (MB) installed to install Oracle Database 11g. No action required.
ALERT: You do not have sufficient physical memory (MB) in your system to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: SwapToRAM OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $swp = "%A00250%" var $mem = "%A00260%" call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(isNumber($swp)), 'SwapNotDetermined',\ expr('<',$swp,1610), 'InsufficientSwap',\ not(expr('>',$mem,0)), 'MemNotDetermined',\ and(expr('>',$mem,1024),expr('<',$mem,2048)),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,expr('*',$mem,1.5)), 'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ and(expr('>',$mem,2049),expr('<',$mem,8192)),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,$mem), 'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ expr('>',$mem,8192),\ cond(expr('<',$swp,expr('*',$mem,0.75)),'SwapLessThanRAM','SwapToRAMOK'),\ 'SwapToRAMOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the total amount of swap space is greater than or equal to the amount recommended by the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for AIX''.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The amount of swap space meets the minimum requirement for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

The amount of swap space is less than the amount recommended by the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for AIX''. Verify the requirements and adjust your system accordingly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |SwapNotDetermined|ALERT- A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because swap is not setup or you do not have execute permissions to determine swap| |SwapLessThanRAM|ALERT- Swap space is less than the physical memory. Set swap space to at least the same size as the physical memory| |InsufficientSwap|ALERT- Oracle Database 11g requires at least 1.5 GB of swap space| |MemNotDetermined|ALERT- A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because you do not have execute permissions to determine the physical memory|

sdp_rule.name: IP Address
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host IP address.

sdp_rule.name: Domain Name
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host domain name.

sdp_rule.name: DNS Lookup
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $ip = "%A00290%" var $hst = field('\.',0,command('hostname')) call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(length($ip)),\ 'Cannot determine IP address',\ not(testFile('x','/usr/bin/nslookup')),\ 'Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup',\ and(grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup ',$hst),quote($ip),'f'),\ grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup ',$ip),quote($hst),'f')),\ 'Host correctly registered in DNS',\ 'Host not correctly registered in DNS'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the host is registered correctly in the DNS.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The host is registered correctly in the DNS.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Host not correctly registered in DNS|Register the host.domain in the DNS.| |Cannot determine IP address|Fix any problem with the host IP address.| |Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/bin/nslookup`` to the current user.|

sdp_rule.name: /etc/hosts Format
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``/etc/hosts`` file contains a line with ``ip_address fully_qualified_domainname short_hostname``.

sdp_rule.name: Got OS Patches?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_LVL macro get_patches {var (\@tbl) = @arg import $OS_LVL var $OS4 = field('\-',0,$OS_LVL) macro check_patches {var (\@tbl,$val,@pch) = @arg import $OS_LVL if compare('lt',replace($OS_LVL,'\-','',true),$val) {loop $pch (@pch) {if grepCommand(concat('/usr/sbin/instfix -ik ',$pch),'no','if') call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pch,'] not installed')) } } } if compare('eq',$OS4,'5300') call check_patches(\@tbl,'530005','IY89080','IY92037','IY94343','IZ01060',\ 'IZ03260') elsif compare('eq',$OS4,'6100') call push(@tbl,'NotChecked') else call push(@tbl,concat($OS4,' is not supported')) } call cond(not(testFile('x','/usr/sbin/instfix')),push(@tbl,'NoAccess'),\ get_patches(\@tbl)) call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),'PatchesFound'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the OS patches required for the Oracle Database 11g installation.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All required OS patches are found. No action required.

Some of the required OS patches were not met or found. Review the recommended OS patches from the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for AIX'' before installing the software. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |... not installed|Install the OS patch or its latest version.%BR%5.3: IY89080, IY92037, IY94343, IZ01060, and IZ03260| |NoAccess|OS patches could not be verified because the user has no execute permissions to ``/usr/sbin/instfix``. Provide the user with execute permissions.|

sdp_rule.name: Got OS Packages?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var @tbl = () macro check_package {var (\@tbl) = @arg import $OS_LVL var $OS4 = field('\-',0,$OS_LVL) call loadCommand('/usr/bin/lslpp -l') loop $pkg ('bos.adt.base','bos.adt.lib','bos.adt.libm','bos.perf.libperfstat',\ 'bos.perf.perfstat','bos.perf.proctools',\ check($OS4,'^6100$','xlC.aix61.rte','xlC.aix50.rte'),'xlC.rte') {var (undef,$lvl,$sta,undef) = \ split('\s+',trim(grepLastFile(quote($pkg),'f')),4) if $sta {if and(compare('ne',$sta,'COMMITTED'),compare('ne',$sta,'APPLIED')) call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not applied')) elsif compare('eq',$OS4,'6100') {if and(compare('eq',$pkg,'xlC.aix61.rte'),\ not(compare('valid',$lvl,'9.0.0.1'))) call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not applied')) elsif and(compare('eq',$pkg,'xlC.rte'),\ not(compare('valid',$lvl,'9.0.0.1'))) call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not applied')) } elsif compare('eq',$OS4,'5300') {if and(compare('eq',$pkg,'xlC.aix50.rte'),\ not(compare('valid',$lvl,'8.0.0.3'))) call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not applied')) elsif and(compare('eq',$pkg,'xlC.rte'),\ not(compare('valid',$lvl,'8.0.0.0'))) call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not applied')) } } else call push(@tbl,concat('[',$pkg,'] not installed')) } } call cond(testFile('x','/usr/bin/lslpp'),check_package(\@tbl),\ push(@tbl,'NoAccess')) call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),\ 'All required OS packages are installed'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that all required OS packages are installed.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All required OS packages are installed. No action required.

Refer to the following list of required OS packages: ``bos.adt.base``, ``bos.adt.lib``, ``bos.adt.libm``, ``bos.perf.perfstat``, ``bos.perf.proctools``, ``xlC.aix50.rte`` (for 5.3), ``xlC.aix61.rte`` (for 6.1), and ``xlC.rte``.| |... not applied|The package was found but is not applied or committed.
